review_title: you pay to get the game pay more to play
one_reviews_text:
bought the game and you have to pay to unlock more levels.
go to steam its like £3 with all levels unlocked

DO NOT BUY, unless it is maybe 90% off or higher. Even then.... 

You have to pay more money to  unlock another 6-10 games that are build into the original game. Disgusting. 

Why should I pay to unlock content in a game, I JUST PAID FOR?

review_title: Gotta pay MORE to open full game? WTF
one_reviews_text:
Sorry Devs, but this is bullcrap.  Cleary you don't care, as you didn't address your other paying customers. To bad, cause the section you can play are fun. But as a warning to future, potential customers...

You pay....   then have to pay MORE.    Awesome right?

Bought during a sale, using free credit from Oculus. Absolutely would not suggest spending money on this, as someone else said, you have to pay to unlock parts of the game. It's a f***ing mini-game game. Why the hell would anyone want to pay multiple times to play virtual arcade games. Even though you can unlock certain parts with in game tickets, it takes way too long to get enough tickets, i.e, they designed it in such a way to push you to pay to unlock even those. So glad I didn't actually pay anything for this.

Was enjoying the progression, Going through the minigames.. Getting tickets to unlock new alleys. To my dissapointment the last 2 alleys you have to pay for, indivudlaly. To unlock the rest of the game is going to cost another £10 -£12... Kinda disgusted me... Package the whole game, and set a price. Don't sell 'Half-3/4 of the game' an then ask me for more money for the rest? 1 star, I don't like being taken for a mug. I wouldn't of purchased it, had i known.

review_title: A FIX FOR THE GAME NOT LOADING
one_reviews_text: I bought this game on sale for $5 thinking I was getting a good deal, at first I wasn't, the game window would pop up for a few seconds then disappear. I was about to uninstall the game until I changed the graphics processor to the High-Preformance NVIDIA Processor (may be different for your computer I'm not an expert). The game started working after that and I've been having fun.

review_title: dont know whats wrong but i cant get it
one_reviews_text: I really love these kinds of games but cant get this one going. Ideas???
My kids love this game

Three weeks on ... Still NOT WORKING !!!

Opens a Black window on screen, only a breif egg-timer in HMD then BLACK

Closing window, causes Oculus Home and server to crash, requiring Full PC restart, to clear the error.

The game got me around 2 hours of entertainment with my partner
So even at 4,99 discount price its a bit steep.
And I did not encounter any problems unlocking the other attractions like other people say (it's pretty straight forward tbh)

for 5 bucks sure. full price is kind of a rip-off

On Steam the DLC is regularly on sale for $1.99. Somehow Oculus Home never does though! 
Game is a cluster of boring minigames, with controls that are not very good. You aim with your palm sort of, or underhand when selecting menus which is bizzare!!

You start off with two short mini-games, and by playing you can unlock ten more games for FREE. You can also BUY another 6 mini-games from INSIDE the game (not directly from the Oculus Store) for an extra 8.00. Unfortunately the teleport angle that is only designed for an HTC Vive wand is WAY OFF on Touch (like 90° off, so you have to point your hand up to the sky to teleport forward ???), and even worse instead of grabing and throwing things with the Touch's grab button, you can only pinch and flick things with the Touch's trigger button (still playable, but it feels weird and this is a very big immersion killer). I wish they would fix these two basic controller problems (and maybe allow to buy the DLC directly from the Oculus Store, so people who stopped playing can notice it's existence), but even after releasing the DLC they still haven't fixed the controller problems, so only 3-stars for this lazy HTC Vive port because of it's annoyingly bad Touch controller support.

review_title: Could be great - ruined by locked levels
one_reviews_text:
For those who have played Pierhead, do not expect the same freedom.

This game has the potential to be just as enjoyable, but unfortunately restricts players to completing the same "tutorial" style mini games over and over again as they must complete same stages upon every game restart and complete each one in turn and purchase required rewards before they are able to move on to the next game. 

If this game were free or early access - fair enough. For an RRP of £15 however, I would like a game playable on my terms, not blocked off. 

Really disappointed as I feel I could really enjoy this game as the actual mini games themselves are great and the graphics are fun and well done. Do not understand the need for permanent blocking of games and progress. 

Paid 3.99 in sale for this, and still feel it was to much. If all aspects of the "carnival" were fully playable, I would be lauding it as a great buy at £15 RRP. Perplexing move by developers to cut themselves so short.

Please guys - update and sort this out - allow players the freedom to play the games they like!!!

review_title: Fun game but much content behind IAP.
one_reviews_text: The kids enjoy the mini games much as they enjoy Carnival Games on the Wii. Its not deep but it is easy to get into. However, much of the content is locked behind an IAP paywall. This was not a free or even cheap game, it should not have this kind of phone game IAP model. Spend your money elsewhere.

This 1 star rating is for the DLC Alley Adventure.

For the Carnival Games VR, it does not require internet connectivity. For the DLC Alley Adventure, it REQUIRES internet connectivity. Once you purchase the DLC, you must be connected to the internet in order to access those areas. In an email from 2K support, they are unable to fix/change this DLC for offline access.

The DLC itself only contains 1-2 games worth playing. They are both in the same area Cosmic Corner, putting green and the gravity gun game. I do not recommend this DLC for purchase.

This is one of my favorite games!  You are transported to a cartoon carnival where you can play lots of fun games, win tickets, and get prizes.  I'm hoping that more content is added.  I have not had any of the issues that some others have complained about.
Paid, downloaded, installed and doesnt run... says it need vr-runtime.
9 months later I still play this game. It's simply fun, so don't let a few negative reviews like rating it 2 stars because there's an additional section you can optionally buy.

review_title: Cannot Download this game  FIX IT!!!
one_reviews_text: Cannot download this game after purchase it keeps on stopping FIX IT!!! Moronic site this is!!!
Love this game, great price

review_title: Need more great games like this
one_reviews_text: Going to a vr amusement park to play those side games that cost so much money in the real world is fun.Jesusavesouls !

I was really excited for this game because I remembered enjoying carnival games with my family when the wii came out. Unfortuantely, I can't even play the game because it crashes when I try to play it. If someone has a solution please let me know because this is really dissapointing.

The game is pretty decent, I myself havent had many of the control issues that others have. However, what is annoying is that at every moment during gameplay the save file fails. Loosing whatever progress you make sucks, and after looking online there is no clear resolution to this. I wouldn't reccommend this game, by some of the other carnival games which actually saves your progress.

This is a great little intro to the world of VR, certainly for the younger players or with a group of friends round. Clearly, it's not boasting stunning visuals but there is enough variety in the games for many hours of fun and the global / friends scoreboard is great if you have friends with VR too. Would be cool to see a new game or two added in future at some point? Worth buying - Certainly, although maybe not at its full price. If you can get it for £15.00 or under in a sale, you won't be disappointed.

I'm really enjoying this game and it has a lot of potential.  However, the touch controllers need more attention.  They seem to go out of sync frequently, and slows down your pace and accuracy when playing some of the games.  Work out those kinks and this game can be much better!

review_title: Not sure if it's a bug...
one_reviews_text:
... but the controlls are horrible!! Pressing both thumbstick buttons in order to adjust the view? Ok. But everytime the view is adjusted the height gets changed for some reason. Grabbing objects is handled with the rear trigger button. Selecting a place to go sometimes works and sometimes doesn't. Sometimes you just end up with something in your hand. 

TD;DR: One of the worst VR experiences I had.

I just bought the game on sale for $5 and the game started up fine and there were no crashes or any problems with tracking, the touch controllers worked fine even with 2 sensors and a small space (standing room only).  The 3 mini-games I played were fine for this type of game.  However, the game developer made a bad decision in locking games.  You can only play 2 at the start and you have to earn enough tickets to then play a 3rd game and so forth.  It's a really bad implementation of unlocks.  There are leaderboards and there are better "carnival", "arcade" VR mini-games, but this one is probably runs the smoothest without any tracking problems.  Considering the sale price I recommend, but mileage may vary.  Think kids would like this version of mini-games more than adults since they are simple to play (less frustration).
Even after multiple re-installs it keeps crashing on startup... Will be requesting a refund.

I downloded another game just to confirm this message & the other game worked.
The game is the issue please return money back.

review_title: so much better then i expected
one_reviews_text: I've got a pc that is far below required specs and this game ran amazingly. It's a really fun game when i have friends over it's all we play . I just wish there was more minigames to unlock.
Bought this to play with my daughter; crashes on startup even after multiple re-installs.
Game crashes on startup
I have tried installing the game twice and updating the drivers, yet this game still will not load. Other games work fine. Seems many other people are having this issue.
Holy crap, this app is more than perfect!

Picked this up during the Summer Sale. I had my eye on this as these types of fairground mini-games lend themselves well to VR, as long as the physics are good. You start off with a few games of chance, but have to unlock the other areas and games by using winning tickets to purchase themed toys (which are keys to the unlockables).


 Some games are simply no fun at all (the hit the target to dunk the person in the tank comes to mind), while others, like the Rock climbing, Ring Toss, skee ball and horse raising are fun! My personal favorite is the Haunted House shooting gallery, though the premise is super basic. It's like riding through a real carnival ride (I wish all the rides were rideable). If only it ramped up in difficulty!  

There's tons of toys to win and collect with tickets, and the controls are straightforward, which works out great for non-VR visitors.  The master of ceremonies comments quickly become repetitive, but you can turn this annoyance off in options. With the incentive to win tickets,  Carnival Games retains more interest than the visually cool,  but worth only one visit Nivida tech demo.
In short, boring for anyone over 12! :(
how do I ask for a refund? the game dosen´t work!!!!!
There are so many fun games to play in this Carnival Game, I would reccomend this game to anyone who has VR, it is amazing!

I am enjoying this game and just unlocked all the carnival games. The castle climbing, funnel cake catching and haunted funhouse ride are my favorites.  

I did have to go into settings and shut that carnival guy's voice off though.  He was getting on my nerves. Now that he is silent, it is much better.

review_title: Game didn't Start for me either
one_reviews_text: I also had the same problem as others below. The game would not start. Other games have started fine, it is specifically this game. I get an error message on my PC and on oculus headset every time! Fix this or please refund my purchase!
The shooting gallery, the hautned house and the climbing wall are all fun, challenging and top-notch VR experiences.
£14.99..... and fails to load. No apparent fix. Not impressed

The controls work perfectly (except for in the horse racing game) for me and the games are a lot of fun, but I'm not sure that there is $22 worth of fun in here. If this were half the price I'd say definitely check it out, but unless you have kids who play, you really like fair games or they add more content I would hold off. IMO this is quite a lot better than the Nvidia one, but that one is free. Now, if they let me ride some of the rides that you can see in the background I may have to change my opinion. But they dont.

review_title: Only if you have small children
one_reviews_text: Controls are loose at best and I sware if I ever see a carnie that resembles the mustached man in the game I may loose my mind and attack him because of this game.  Pass on this one, NVIDIA's tech demo does everything better and is free.

review_title: Touch was made for games like this
one_reviews_text: Since Oculus Touch is mainly about grabbing and throwing things, what better to exploit this than an old-time carnival game, complete with prizes, booths and a derby-wearing barker? Grab balls and thow them at milk bottles, play a shooting range with guns that never run out of ammo, climb the castle walls and much more. Reasonably good physics, sound effects and whimsical, detailed graphics, along with randomized patrons, various attractions and rides visible in the distance, create the feeling of actually being there.
